_comment: Created by JMorris on 09/05/2018 14:37:39 using v2.7
title: How long do people wait for treatment to begin?
analysis_commentary:
While adherence to the four-hour target is the iconic measure of A&E performance, the length of time between patients arriving in A&E and their treatment beginning is another important indicator. This chart shows that the median treatment waiting time has changed little since 2011 and ranges from a low of 46 minutes in January 2015 to a high of 69 minutes in March 2016.

Interestingly, the 95th percentile value - that is, waiting times for some of the patients that wait the longest - fluctuated at around 185 minutes until August 2015, before increasing to 223 minutes in March 2016. Since then, the 95th percentile value has fluctuated at a higher level of about 210 minutes. A peak of 230 minutes was reached in December 2017. It's worth noting that this measure can be sensitive to data quality issues.

Updated April 2018.
